strings.Value: "Now is no time to discuss your dreams. We're on the march! Pack up and we're off!"
"I see you didn't get much sleep. Should we stay here a little longer?"
"I'll try to find you a doctor or a wizard who can make these dreams go away."
"Maybe the dreams will fade in time."
"Next time you're not sleeping well, wake me up. I have some... medicine for you!"
"You might think so. But in fact you're kicking so much that my legs are covered in bruises the next morning!"
"You're never going back there, ever."
"Do you ever want to actually return to Numeria? As free people, not as fugitives?"
{n}Octavia doesn't look well: her eyes are red and swollen, and she looks lost. When she notices you watching her, she smiles sadly.{/n} "Same thing every night..."

"Yes... I used to dream about everything they did to me in {g|Numeria}Numeria{/g}. But now there are new nightmares instead: I'm not in my tent, but in {g|Starfall}Starfall{/g}, or {g|Hajot Hakados}Hajoth Hakados{/g}, or in a boat sailing the {g|Little Sellen River}Sellen{/g}... And I know the {g|Technic League}Technic League's{/g} agents are there. They're about to get us — but I can't move!"

"I even went to a temple — thought maybe it was a curse or something. The priestess told me that gods and magic have nothing to do with it — that it's all in my head. It's not like I can get rid of my head."
"No, don't. If I did go back to sleep, the nightmares would only come back. I'm fine, really! Let's go."
"Yes, of course! I'm ready."
"Yeah, me too. Let's go!"
"Thank you. But I've looked myself — to no avail. Don't worry, they're only dreams."

{n}The half-elf smiles at you.{/n} "You're so worried about me... Don't be. In {g|Numeria}Numeria{/g}, Reg and I lived a waking nightmare, and we dreamed happy dreams of freedom. Now we live happy as ever — so the nightmare had to move into my dreams. The druids must be right when they say there's a balance everywhere in nature."
"Ha ha, yeah, right. You and Reg can only think about one thing! Although... Sure — why not try it!"
"Maybe. No nightmare can live forever — we've killed enough to know!"
"Let's stock up on good memories. Memories of victories, feasts... Maybe if we pile enough up, they'll force the bad memories out!"
"Good plan!"
{n}The girl's tired face brightens up with a smile.{/n} "So I'm not the only one suffering from these nightmares."
"I know. But how do I tell that to the nightmares?"
"No, {g|Calistria}Calistria{/g} save me! I don't ever want to set foot on {g|Numeria}Numerian{/g} soil ever again. Nothing but nightmares await me there — old and new."
"Nightmares again?" {n}The half-orc runs his fingers through Octavia's hair compassionately.{/n} "They just won't let you go!"
"I'm so tired of this! You're suffering, and I can't do anything! Maybe there's some magic to get them out of your head and smash them to pieces? There must be something!"
